attributes.description: Conservative progression block designed to establish new baseline maxes on deadlift, squat, bench press, and push press while respecting limited recovery capacity (6-hour sleep, high work stress). Focuses on systematic strength development with integrated mobility work and conditioning.
attributes.name: 4-Week Max Testing Preparation Block

phases.description: Build work capacity and technical proficiency on main lifts with moderate volume and intensity. Establish movement patterns and prepare body for intensification.
phases.name: Volume Building Phase

phases.description: Increase load while reducing volume. Push intensity on main lifts while maintaining conditioning work. Conservative progression given recovery constraints.
phases.name: Intensification Phase

phases.description: Reduce volume significantly to allow full recovery. Peak strength and test current maxes on all four main lifts to establish new baselines.
phases.name: Taper and Max Testing

trainingGoals: Test current max on back squat (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on bench press (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on push press (baseline: 165x3)
Establish new baseline maxes for future programming
Improve shoulder mobility through consistent warm-up protocols
Maintain conditioning capacity with finishers and one longer session weekly
